title: Government Announces New Policies for Digital Bangladesh
details: The government has announced a series of new policies aimed at furthering the development of Digital Bangladesh. These include initiatives for increasing internet access in rural areas and promoting local tech startups.
author: Shamim Ahmed

title: Floods in Northern Bangladesh: Thousands Displaced
details: Heavy monsoon rains have caused severe flooding in the northern districts of Bangladesh, displacing thousands of people. Relief efforts are underway, but authorities are warning of more rains in the coming days.
author: Rina Begum

title: Bangladesh Cricket Team Wins T20 Series Against India
details: In a thrilling T20 series, the Bangladesh cricket team defeated India by 5 wickets in the final match, securing a 2-1 series victory. Fans celebrated the historic win across the country.
author: Jahidul Islam

title: Chattogram Metro Project Progressing Rapidly
details: The Chattogram Metro Rail Project is making rapid progress, with 60% of the work already completed. The project is expected to alleviate traffic congestion in the port city, improving commute times for residents.
author: Nasima Khatun

title: Bangladesh RMG Sector Sees Significant Growth in Exports
details: Bangladesh's Ready-Made Garment (RMG) sector has experienced a significant increase in exports this year, with total exports reaching a new high. Experts credit the rise in demand in European and American markets for this growth.
author: Tariq Hasan

title: Power Outage Hits Dhaka Amid Heatwave
details: A major power outage has affected large parts of Dhaka, leaving residents struggling amid a severe heatwave. Authorities are working to restore power, but many areas remain without electricity for hours.
author: Farhana Islam

title: Government Launches Campaign to Combat Dengue
details: In response to the rising number of dengue cases, the government has launched a nationwide campaign to combat the spread of the disease. Measures include increased mosquito control efforts and public awareness programs.
author: Mehedi Hasan

title: New Metro Line to Connect Dhaka Airport and Downtown
details: The Dhaka metro rail project is set to expand with a new line that will connect the airport to downtown Dhaka. This is expected to significantly reduce travel time for commuters and tourists.
author: Anika Rahman

title: Record Rice Harvest in Sylhet Boosts Local Economy
details: Farmers in Sylhet are celebrating a record rice harvest this year, which is expected to boost the local economy. The favorable weather conditions and government support have been credited for this success.
author: Shakib Hossain

title: High-Speed Internet Now Available in Remote Areas of Bangladesh
details: In a major step towards Digital Bangladesh, the government has rolled out high-speed internet services in some of the most remote areas of the country, giving millions of people access to the digital economy.
author: Muntasir Mahmud

title: Bangladesh Celebrates Victory Day with Grand Parades
details: On the occasion of Victory Day, parades and cultural events were held across the country to celebrate Bangladesh's independence. Thousands gathered at the National Parade Ground in Dhaka to witness the military display.
author: Fahim Rahman

title: Robi Axiata Expands 5G Coverage Across Bangladesh
details: Telecom operator Robi Axiata has expanded its 5G network across major cities in Bangladesh, aiming to provide faster internet speeds and better connectivity to millions of users.
author: Arif Mahmood

title: Rohingya Refugee Crisis: UN Urges More International Support
details: The United Nations has called for increased international support to handle the Rohingya refugee crisis, as over 1 million refugees continue to live in camps in Cox’s Bazar, Bangladesh.
author: Samira Hossain

title: Bangladesh to Host Next South Asian Games in 2025
details: Bangladesh has been confirmed as the host for the 2025 South Asian Games. This announcement was made during a press conference in Dhaka. The government has begun preparations to make the event a grand success.
author: Hasan Shakil

title: Garment Workers Protest for Better Wages in Gazipur
details: Thousands of garment workers took to the streets in Gazipur, demanding better wages and working conditions. Factory owners have initiated talks with worker unions to resolve the dispute.
author: Sumaiya Akter

title: Massive Tree Plantation Drive Launched to Combat Climate Change
details: In a bid to combat the effects of climate change, the government has launched a massive tree plantation drive across Bangladesh, aiming to plant 10 million trees by the end of the year.
author: Mahmudul Haque

title: Dhaka University Celebrates 100 Years of Excellence
details: Dhaka University is celebrating its centenary with a series of events, including academic seminars, cultural programs, and alumni gatherings. The institution has played a pivotal role in shaping the country’s intellectual and political landscape.
author: Nusrat Jahan

title: Chattogram Port Handles Record Number of Containers
details: Chattogram Port has set a new record by handling the highest number of containers in a single month. This achievement is seen as a reflection of Bangladesh's growing international trade.
author: Shafique Rahman

title: Eid Festival Boosts Domestic Tourism Across Bangladesh
details: The Eid festival has given a significant boost to domestic tourism, with popular destinations like Cox’s Bazar, Sylhet, and the Sundarbans seeing a surge in visitors during the holiday season.
author: Asif Iqbal

title: Sheikh Hasina Inaugurates New Industrial Park in Narayanganj
details: Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has inaugurated a new industrial park in Narayanganj, which is expected to create thousands of jobs and attract significant foreign investment in the region.
author: Rafiqul Islam

title: Padma Bridge Toll Collection Hits Record High in August
details: The Padma Bridge has set a new record for toll collection in August, as thousands of vehicles used the bridge to cross the river daily. The bridge has significantly reduced travel time between the capital and the southern districts.
author: Tasnim Ahmed

title: Monsoon Rains Cause Widespread Flooding in Northern Bangladesh
details: Heavy monsoon rains have caused severe flooding in northern Bangladesh, affecting thousands of families and damaging crops. The government has mobilized rescue teams and aid for the affected regions.
author: Nazmul Huda

title: Bangladesh Achieves 100% Renewable Energy in Coastal Areas
details: Bangladesh has successfully achieved 100% renewable energy in several coastal areas, with solar and wind energy now powering homes and businesses. This marks a significant step toward the country's green energy goals.
author: Raihan Karim

title: Metro Rail to Start Operations in Chattogram by 2025
details: The government has announced plans to launch the first metro rail system in Chattogram by 2025. The project aims to ease traffic congestion and improve public transportation in the port city.
author: Mariam Akter

title: Digital Literacy Campaign Launched in Rural Bangladesh
details: A new digital literacy campaign has been launched in rural areas to equip people with essential computer and internet skills. The initiative is expected to benefit students, farmers, and small business owners in underdeveloped regions.
author: Sabina Yasmin
